ratings.question_text: The readings/cases/textbooks used in this course were __________ .
Out-of-class assignments for this course were ___________ to my learning.
The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Question 10:The instructor was wonderful - readily available, receptive to questions, the entire classfelt very structured and moved from basic to more advanced concepts at a perfect pace. I'd absolutely recommend the instructor and course to anyone interested.
Shimi's reputation as one of the best teachers in fes is well deserved. I really appreciate the work heputs into teaching. Superior class.

Shimi is the best professor I have had at FES! His lectures, course materials/handouts, assignments arewell thought out and selected. The outline of the course is very clear and his expectations of what he requires from us is very clear. I was also amazed at how much time he makes available for office hours (at least 5hrs a week!). Other FES professors offer office hours by appointment which for a busy grad student is hard to plan ahead but with Shimi's class I always knew what that certain times during the week he would be available so it was easy to show up for help. The fact that his course is so well organized is a signal that he cares about teaching well and ensuring that students learn. He also prepares notes on his lectures that are extremely helpful for students who are not so well versed in the sciences and need extra help. REALLY AMAZING PROFESSOR!

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The emphasis on starting with a strong chemistry foundation, to real-life applications.
It covered a wide range of topics and Shimi goes through things efficiently, but is always willing to back up and repeat things if students don't understand.
Very clear instruction, excellent handouts and course assignments! Lots of time offered for office hours.

Professor uses a combined approach of science fundamentals and environmental management applications that should be more common among FES course and instruction methodology -- whether in the natural or social sciences. The class is very well designed and taught thoroughly. Professor makes himself available to teach and discuss material with students for an engaged form of learning that I find highly effective.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I actually can't think of any!
I think it would be great to emphasize current issues a bit more and add a few more case studies.
nothing
I wish there was more time in the semester to go into greater detail on material covered in the last month of class!

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Relationship was very good
Excellent!

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: This is a wonderful compliment to my environmental health/exposure curriculum. It provides a the context (how chemicals move through the environment) that is incredibly relevant for my required courses in exposure assessment, risk assessment, and environmental epidemiology.
This course is very closely related to my area of study at FES. I dont have a chemistry background but Shimi organizes the class in such a way that anyone can do well in his class.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: For fun!
Because I find the subject very interesting and I really enjoy classes taught by Shimi.
Wanted to learn about a topic relevant to site remediation.
It is linked to my current research on the links between climate change and health (from a toxic pollutant perspective)

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Any knowledge/skills I didn't absorb were the result of a very demanding semester, not this course itself. This course was an elective, and I'm very glad I stuck with it.
Yes
Exceeded them
I expected the course to be extremely difficult and it was very difficult but it was better than I expected because it was very well taught!

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: We worked on in-class work activities only.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it! But not if you're already taking 5 other courses. If I could do it again, I'd save one of my required courses for next year to focus on this one. It was really great.
Anyone from any background can take this class and pass! Amazing professor! very dedicated...
